Package BobcatLib.Hardware.Encoders

Class ThriftyAbsoluteEncoder

java.lang.Object
BobcatLib.Hardware.Encoders.ThriftyAbsoluteEncoder
All Implemented Interfaces:
EncoderIO
public class ThriftyAbsoluteEncoder extends Object implements EncoderIO
The ThriftyAbsoluteEncoder class implements the EncoderIO interface and provides methods for working with an absolute encoder connected via analog input. It supports configuring the encoder's inversion, getting its absolute position, and managing faults (though no actual faults management is implemented for this encoder type).

  • Constructor Details

    • ThriftyAbsoluteEncoder

      public ThriftyAbsoluteEncoder(CANDeviceDetails details, EncoderConstants chosenModule)
      Constructor for creating a ThriftyAbsoluteEncoder instance. This method sets up the encoder based on the provided device details and configuration.
      Parameters:
      details - The CAN device details (e.g., CAN ID).
      chosenModule - The encoder configuration constants (e.g., inversion settings).

  • Method Details

    • configAbsEncoder

      public void configAbsEncoder()
      Configures the absolute encoder sensor, including setting its inversion. This method uses the configuration settings to apply the correct inversion logic.
      Specified by:
      configAbsEncoder in interface EncoderIO

    • getAbsolutePosition

      public double getAbsolutePosition()
      Gets the absolute position of the encoder. The position is returned as a normalized rotation value between -1.0 and 1.0, with the sign of the value adjusted based on the encoder's inversion setting.
      Specified by:
      getAbsolutePosition in interface EncoderIO
      Returns:
      The absolute position of the encoder in the range (-1 to 1).

    • factoryDefault

      public void factoryDefault()
      Resets the encoder to its factory defaults. For this encoder type, this method does nothing as there are no configurable settings to reset.
      Specified by:
      factoryDefault in interface EncoderIO

    • clearStickyFaults

      public void clearStickyFaults()
      Clears sticky faults on the encoder. For this encoder type, this method does nothing as no sticky faults are managed.
      Specified by:
      clearStickyFaults in interface EncoderIO

    • checkForFaults

      public void checkForFaults()
      Checks for any faults in the encoder. For this encoder type, this method does nothing as no faults are managed.
      Specified by:
      checkForFaults in interface EncoderIO
